programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi hope for more good luck as the buyers return to San Diego, while Ivy comes across a cross-dressing locker.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts appraise a 1958 Glastron Seaflight boat, a copy of Dracula signed by author Bram Stoker, and a collection of antique billiard items.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee investigates a pirate ship parade float, and the boys are given a chance to cast their eyes over a collection of 17 one ounce silver art bars from the early 1970s.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Funk singer George Clinton challenges Rick and the team to return a 1920s grand piano to its former glory.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a 1950s table hockey game while the team work on a slot machine that rewards winners with cigars instead of money.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The crew members discuss their best and worst times on the mountain, looking back on their toughest wrecks, worst injuries and contemplating why they endure such dangers.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Marc transports a cargo of four million live bees across the country, but has a hard time keeping the insects under control, while New Orleans couple the Bodens end up in a mess while hauling a collection of dollhouses.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Jarrett transports a pedal-powered mobile bar, and Jenny hauls a giant arcade game that may be too big for her trailer.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Police investigate the case of a woman whose body was found in a rubbish bin, in a bid to discover whether she was the victim of a co-worker's violent obsession.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Actor Zachary Quinto hosts this reboot of the 1970s documentary series that explores the unexplained. He begins with a search for extraterrestrial life.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zach sets out to research the strangest creatures from the depths of the ocean and to see how much they lend to the monsters of myth and legend.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The smiths are tasked with forging Dave Baker's favourite blade, the Scottish Dirk.Two head on to the final round, to recreate the German Halberd, a medieval-era triple threat.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Former winners return for the chance to craft a weapon known for its unique mechanics and deadly double-edged blade - the pata.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: After his sacking, Rich returns to the shop in a last-ditch effort to win back his job. Seth continues his attempt to take over the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An electric chair gives Rich the chance to get back in Les's good books, and Seth hatches a scheme that could make a fortune for the store.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Shop owner Les is reluctant to trust a group of clients who tell him a story, and he later makes an important discovery.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth is shocked to discover that Les has brought back ex-employee Amy, whom he suspects may have made a mistake that could cost the store thousands of dollars.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba's nemesis Kenny Stowe shows up at tense auctions in Mesquite, where struggling Victor proves he is desperate for bargains.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa Lewis and Jerry Simpson compete against Jenny Grumbles and Mary Padian at an auction on their own turf in Longview.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An English bidder turns up at Fort Worth. Victor acquires some spy equipment, while Ricky and Bubba have their eyes on something far more dangerous.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba plan to get revenge on a rival at an auction in Dallas, and arguments erupt surrounding a musical instrument.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary shows a different side to her personality in Dallas and soon has a roaring crowd on its feet. Meanwhile, Ricky and Bubba are led astray by their latest find.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Fort Worth witnesses a showdown when Cowboy Matt begins throwing his weight around. Jenny's wins a locker containing a very strange item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys haggle over the price of a rare mandolin, a 1950s woodworking machine and the business card of a famous outlaw.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered puppets from Buffalo Bill's Wild West Show and a yearbook containing a letter bearing the signature of one-time US president Ronald Reagan.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys snap to attention when a client brings in a rare West Point musket. They also get offered pilot licences signed by father of flight Orville Wright.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items appraised include an antique electrotherapy kit, a 19th-century revolving cannon, a jukebox from 1973 and a 50-year-old electric waffle iron.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a piece of marble from Abraham Lincoln's tomb, an African sword and an antique Charlie Chaplin doll, but are not sure if the sellers are trustworthy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and the Old Man examine a pipe belonging to President Ulysses S Grant and a shoe from the famous racehorse Secretariat.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value a hat belonging to a member of Lynyrd Skynyrd and a sports car.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts appraise a collection of vintage toy cars, a pair of First World War German Pickelhaube helmets and a necklace once owned by Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The experts appraise a 1958 Glastron Seaflight boat, a copy of Dracula signed by author Bram Stoker, and a collection of antique billiard items.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee investigates a pirate ship parade float, and the boys are given a chance to cast their eyes over a collection of 17 one ounce silver art bars from the early 1970s.

programme.title: In Search of Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos heads to Peru to investigate whether the strange symbols covering its desert floor are key to proving aliens once visited Earth.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: While the excavation of Smith's Cove continues to uncover an abundance of ancient structures, Rick, Marty and the team resume the treasure hunt.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether common human rituals may have been inspired by contact with aliens.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Rimmer gets hold of a Quantum skipper and skips his way across the multi-verse looking for a dimension where he is not such a giant loser. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Josh Widdicombe, Milton Jones, Zoe Lyons and Matt Forde join regulars Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines in July 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe, Romesh Ranganathan and Ed Gamble join regulars Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines in July 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Katy Brand, Ed Gamble, Suzannah Lipscomb and Amol Rajan join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share the name Paul, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: The Horne Section Television Programme
programme.desc: A special variety show with Alex Horne and his band, The Horne Section, showcasing their signature combination of free-wheeling live music and comedy. The show, recorded at the London Palladium, also features guest performances from fellow entertainers including Nadine Coyle, Sue Perkins, Sara Pascoe and Joe Wilkinson.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A 999 call from a teenager sparks a race against time for Nadiene and volunteer Matt. When confronted with an aggressive man, the pair are forced to hit their emergency buttons.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Jaguar XJ and races against the rotation of the Earth. James May travels to America to drive a Nasa Space Exploration Vehicle and Richard Hammond tests two of the most famous supercars of the 1980s - the Porsche 959 and the Ferrari F40. John Prescott is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori head to an auction in Desert Hot Springs, California, and do their best to keep the competition at bay.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: A monster scares the bidders, while Brandon and Lori bet big on a DJ's equipment.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys pick the collection of a reclusive and mysterious businessman named The Colonel, who has gone to great lengths to keep his identity a secret.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a jaw-dropping Kentucky property with a racetrack that revives an old Mike and Frank rivalry. Later, a freestyle stop in North Carolina looks like a bust.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Vigilantes confront a man whom they believe is a paedophile, and the team search for a suspect armed with a meat cleaver.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A succession of knifings leaves the police facing a potential double murder investigation. The team raid the house of a suspected drug dealer and discover weapons.

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: The journey of a $55million batch of cancer pharmaceuticals from Northern Ireland to Heathrow, for a flight to the US. A wildlife officer attempts to scare birds away from a runway.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May straps into a highly tuned hatchback as he competes in a world rallycross race, with Top Gear USA host and professional driver Tanner Foust teaming up with him. Jeremy Clarkson puts the latest Jaguar F-type R and Eagle's modernised E-type the Low Drag GT though their paces, while Richard Hammond is in Spain to test the new version of the Mazda MX-5. Plus, X-Men: First Class star Nicholas Hoult takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take a continental trip in their favourite supercars - the Ford GT, Ferrari F430 and Pagani Zonda. There is a culture clash when the Austin Healey Sprite and Peugeot 306 go head to head, and the Focus ST is put through its paces on the track. Then-transport minister Stephen Ladyman drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Austin, Eddie Hall takes on Superbike legend Colin 'Texas Tornado' Edwards in a strength vs speed race - and sets his own eating challenge from eight of the city's food trucks.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Manhattan, Eddie Hall goes head to head with long-time rival Brian Shaw, pulling a 23-tonne truck - and attempting the notorious skyscraper 'Monster' sandwich from Sarge's Deli.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Highlights from the third series of the comedy panel show presented by Rob Brydon. Featuring team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack alongside guests including Fern Britton, Ken Livingstone, Davina McCall, Russell Howard and Claudia Winkleman.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Fern Britton, Richard E Grant, Sanjeev Bhaskar and Martin Clunes join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon presents.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Celebrity guests Ruth Jones, Jason Manford, Jack Dee and Peter Serafinowicz join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show, in which contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Presented by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Comedy, starring Lee Mack.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Toby organises a sponsored parachute jump to raise money for a children's ward in his hospital, so Lee, Lucy, Anna and the grandparents all agree to take part to support him. But once airborne, will everyone pluck up the courage to jump? Return of the comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The tensions of sharing a weekend cottage with friends are much in evidence as Lee and Lucy spend three nights in the New Forest with Toby and Anna. The beautiful countryside is forgotten as they squabble over who has the better bedroom, where they should go on their day trips, who should do the cooking and who should stay behind on the last day to tidy up the cottage. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.sub-title: Shot Through the Face with a Canon
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites Katherine Ryan, Suzi Ruffell and Rufus Hound to help him make sense of our insensible world.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Josh Widdicombe, Milton Jones, Zoe Lyons and Matt Forde join regulars Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines in July 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Ed Byrne, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe, Romesh Ranganathan and Ed Gamble join regulars Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis to give their irreverent takes on the biggest stories to hit the headlines in July 2015, through stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: How the Japanese air force dropped swarms of fleas on a Chinese city in a bid to infect the population with bubonic plague.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: A Very British Murder with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian tells the story of one of the first high-profile killers - Dr Crippen, who was hanged in 1910 for poisoning and dismembering his wife - before turning her attention to the interwar period, when detective fiction reached the peak of its popularity at the hands of authors Agatha Christie and Dorothy L Sayers. After undergoing the elaborate initiation ceremony of the Detection Club, which was set up by a group of British writers in 1930, Lucy considers how Alfred Hitchcock's films and Graham Greene's books eclipsed the traditional murder-mystery story in the depiction of homicide.

programme.title: A Very British Murder with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: In the second programme, the historian explores how science and detection influenced the popular culture of murder during Victorian times. Writers including Charles Dickens and Wilkie Collins were fascinated by grisly crimes, and the literary genre that came out of it captured the imagination of readers. The presenter also reveals that when Jack the Ripper began his reign of terror in London at the same time Robert Louis Stevenson's Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde was published, the idea of the serial killer was introduced to the British public.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the secretive Rosicrucian Order, whose members included Leonardo Da Vinci and Isaac Newton.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston journeys to Greece and Italy to uncover the truth about oracles - mythical figures who could reputedly hear and speak to gods.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the theory that Nazis were engaged in building spacecraft before the outbreak of the Second World War.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston looks at the life and work of Serbian inventor Nikola Tesla, investigating conspiracy theories that the scientific establishment and national governments covered up his work on energy sources. He also finds out why so little evidence of his experiments remains today.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live on the coast, including sea lions working in packs to hunt tuna in the shallows and moray eels that venture out of the water to seek out food on dry rocks. Puffins must brave predators to bring a mouthful of food back to their young and king penguins go without food for a month while they moult. Plus, footage of the bizarre Leaping Blenny, a fish that hates the water.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Blue Planet II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live on the coast, including sea lions working in packs to hunt tuna in the shallows and moray eels that venture out of the water to seek out food on dry rocks. Puffins must brave predators to bring a mouthful of food back to their young and king penguins go without food for a month while they moult. Plus, footage of the bizarre Leaping Blenny, a fish that hates the water.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: Big in America: British Hits in the USA
programme.desc: Compilation of British rock 'n' roll acts in performance, featuring songs that crossed over to the US charts. From the Dave Clark Five to Coldplay, the Brits have rocked America and sometimes even done better across the pond than on home soil. A Flock of Seagulls, Supertramp and Bush also feature, alongside darker British global exports like Black Sabbath and the Cure.

programme.title: Duran Duran: There's Something You Should Know
programme.desc: Simon Le Bon, John Taylor, Nick Rhodes and Roger Taylor open up about the highs and lows of the band's career - with archive footage of former guitarist Andy Taylor helping round out the story. The documentary charts their trajectory through seven of their 14 albums, each one uncovering a compelling chapter in the history of five lads from Birmingham who had one simple dream - to become the biggest band in the world. Contributors include Boy George, Nile Rodgers and Mark Ronson.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The series examining some of the UK's landmarks continues, with a look at the history of subterranean London, uncovering Roman remains, plague pits and secret bunkers under the capital's streets.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Leo, Nikki and Jack travel to war-torn Afghanistan to identify whether human remains are those of a missing British soldier suspected of being captured by Taliban forces five years earlier. However, they soon discover there is more at stake than identifying a soldier's remains as the crime scene is preventing the completion of a charity-run sanitation plant, putting thousands of lives at risk from contaminated water. William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and David Caves star.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice recommends Daniel's artistic skills to an attractive client, prompting Evie to question her judgement - and the ensuing argument blinds them to Grace's frustration and the suspicious developments at the Bayswater workshop.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Joseph makes a shocking discovery, abruptly ending the sisters' excitement about the new clothing deal.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When a man who arranged to meet Lovejoy at the local cricket game dies suddenly, it falls to the antiques dealer to find the fortune that was promised to the widow. The unusual legacy includes a forged snuff box. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Lady Jane teams up with an entrepreneur named Palmer to convert a warehouse into an Art Nouveau antiques centre. However, Lovejoy suspects he is a conman, so muscles in as an adviser on the project. Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim investigates corporate scandals on Jersey while Danielle grows convinced his life is in danger, but nobody will believe her. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim searches for a runaway wife and becomes embroiled in a cult who believe in the existence of Atlantis. Detective drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: The return of an old enemy leads to a series of problems, beginning with the loss of Sharpe's hard-earned captaincy, and culminating in a race against time to rescue his lover Teresa and their baby from the beleaguered city of Badajoz before Wellesley's forces attack. Military adventure, starring Sean Bean and Pete Postlethwaite.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The pace of Christmas proves too much for Sharon as a few too many slices of chocolate cake sends her off into a dream world where she is the rich member of the family, happily married to rock star husband Chris, while sister Tracey is a downtrodden housewife in a run-down council flat and man-eating neighbour Dorien her dowdy cleaning lady. Festive edition of the comedy from 1994, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph, with a guest appearance by film-maker Michael Winner.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by film-maker Michael Winner

programme.title: Murder on the Blackpool Express
programme.desc: Feature-length comedy about a crime writer (Griff Rhys Jones) who takes a group of his fans on a coach tour of locations from his books. The bus is soon leaving a string of bodies in its wake, and the passengers are faced with the possibility of a murderer in their midst. With Johnny Vegas, Nigel Havers and Una Stubbs.

programme.title: Death on the Tyne
programme.desc: Comedy mystery following on from Murder on the Blackpool Express, focusing this time on an eventful and bloody overnight ferry trip from Newcastle to Amsterdam. During the turbulent journey, the passengers and crew begin to get bumped off one by one in grizzly circumstances, and everyone seems to have a motive for murder. Johnny Vegas, Sian Gibson, Sheila Reid, Sue Johnston, Georgie Glen, James Fleet, Felicity Montagu and Doon Mackichan are among the all-star cast.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: When an animal activist is killed on the first day of duck-hunting season, Mike and the team must determine whether it was an accidental shooting, or something more sinister.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch and Brackenreid send Crabtree undercover at a chess tournament to unravel the murder of a Russian master.

programme.title: Frankie Drake Mysteries
programme.desc: Mary's job is threatened when she accuses Detective Greyson of hiding evidence. Has she overstepped her bounds, or is Greyson a dirty cop?.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.sub-title: The Sum of All Our Choices
programme.desc: A pregnant patient triggers Tara's anxiety and PTSD, while Meryl and Jarrod seek Rod Eagles help, but his price may just be too high for Meryl.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Tara's party antics get her in trouble and send Hugh spiralling on his birthday. Meryl investigates Whyhope's subsidence reports.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.desc: Update on the day's headlines, plus a weather report.

programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: A Week in Interviews
programme.desc: Highlights of some of the best interviews on Sky News over the last seven days.

programme.title: Sky News at 10
programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Jones.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The latest group of men to enter the 'love lift' are a Bruno Mars impersonator, a duck lover, a serial dater and a skip driver, who pull out all the stops in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Paddy McGuinness presents.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Holiday camp entertainers The Hi-De-His from Somerset take on The Wolf Pack from Wolverhampton, battling it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, hosts Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom offer the most successful group a chance to win up to 40,000

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: The Leader Interviews: Boris Johnson - Tonight
programme.desc: With the General Election just days away, Julie Etchingham scrutinises Prime Minister Boris Johnson's time so far in office, examining his vision for the country and plans for Brexit.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Alex falls asleep while guarding his father's castle, allowing Sykronior to turn Kingsland into his new holiday home.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.sub-title: The Truth Is Far Out There
programme.desc: The team members think that they are facing a new Sykronian weapon when a vortex appears in the sky over Enchanted Island.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The GDF begin testing experimental rescue machines.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is take to the wheel of a high-powered sports car, but can he drift it and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, a Christmas volunteer in a supermarket, thinks a burglar is entering overnight and decides to stop him..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes Mrs. Wicket's house-mate when he suffers a flea infestation. Will they get on?.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George adapts the spin cycle of the washing machine causing a black hole to form in the Spuds' kitchen..

programme.title: Guardians of the Galaxy
programme.sub-title: Marvel's Guardians of the Galaxy: The Thanos Threat
programme.desc: When Thanos, Ronan, Nebula and the Ravagers seek to possess powerful and creative relic, the fate of the universe depends on the Guardians of the Galaxy to protect it.

programme.title: Mighty Magiswords!
programme.desc: Vambre and Prohyas return to Adventure Academy where Professor Cyrus sends them on a quest to find the Legendary Knowledge Magisword..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: With West End and Strictly Come Dancing star Danny Mac, and chef Nick Nairn. Plus, Dylan Watkins shows how to make gourmet dinners for dogs, and wine maestro Oz Clarke taste-tests more of the best wines on the supermarket shelves.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner are starting to feel festive with a few winter warmers. Lisa begins with a blue cheese and butternut squash pie, followed by John's sausage casserole. They also serve a family favourite - macaroni cheese, with a twist - and for dessert it's a classic ginger cake served two ways.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by Asimakis Chaniotis, London's youngest Michelin-starred chef, to create a family feast from Greece. The menu starts with scrambled eggs for breakfast and chicken gyros for lunch. Then Asimakis rustles up his mum's meatball soup for dinner before Nadia makes Greek almond crescent biscuits for dessert.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo visits the jewel of the Italian Riviera - the Cinque Terre - five towns that are only accessible by boat or train. He begins in the smallest town, Corniglia, where he meets an opera-singing florist, before hopping on the train to Manarola and the dry-stone wallers responsible for keeping the towns from crumbling into the sea. As he heads toward the end, he also heading to Vernazza, Gino meets wine producers who scale 1,000m above sea level to tend to their vines.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A petty thief is impaled with a pitchfork in sleepy Midsomer Mallow, jeopardising the residents' chances of winning a 'perfect village' competition. To make matters worse, two of the judges are also killed. Murder mystery, starring John Nettles, Daniel Casey, Timothy West and Maggie Steed, along with an appearance by Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: The programme explores what makes this time of the year so special in Britain's countryside. Ben Fogle climbs Helvellyn with a man who battles the elements in the Lake District every day, while Paul Heiney views the Peak District from a glider and Liz Bonnin witnesses thousands of swans begin their journey from the fens of Cambridgeshire to their winter home in Russia.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show, asking three contestants to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Bentley, mechanic David, army paramedic Nick and dancer Josh enter the 'love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval. Host Paddy McGuinness presides over the matching process, and also catches up on the latest developments from all the couples in Fernando's as the dating game bows out for another series.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Actress Sally Phillips, musician Rick Wakeman, professional snowboarder Jenny Jones and impressionist Alistair McGowan pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser, as Bradley Walsh hosts another star-studded edition of the show. The celebrities must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.desc: Ant and Dec present the celebrity challenge, as the famous faces' ordeal in the Australian jungle draws close to its conclusion. The pair offer viewers one last chance to catch up with the remaining contestants, all of whom will have their hearts set on being named King or Queen of the Jungle.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: A special appearance by one of the most famous bands in the history of music, The Who, chatting and performing in the studio ahead of their first new album in 13 years. Also appearing are The Grand Tour and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? host Jeremy Clarkson, and Bafta-nominated actor Samson Kayo.

programme.title: Play to the Whistle
programme.desc: Host Holly Willoughby keeps captains Frank Lampard and Bradley Walsh in check, with guests including GB hockey Olympic gold medallist Sam Quek, sports presenter Jake Humphrey and comedian Rob Beckett. Also providing the laughs are comedians Romesh Ranganathan and Seann Walsh.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how footballs are crafted, how mussels are farmed, and how to design the ultimate fighter pilot's helmet.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer travels to the US to hunt for a DeLorean DMC-12, a car that ceased production in 1982. Once he has acquired one, Edd China is given the task of restoring the stainless steel-clad vehicle, which was manufactured in Belfast.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini attends an annual car collectors' pig roast in a Porsche racing car.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini bids on a 1949 BMV Veritas and hopes to get a classic Thor motorbike up and running.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Footage of everything from human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Boiling Bus, Lethal Landslide, Risky Rescue
programme.desc: Footage of near disasters, featuring a bus full of passengers flooding with water, a kayaker trapped inside a waterfall and travellers being swallowed by a landslide.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado rips into a factory, barrels of turpentine explode, one of the world's fastest boats crashes upside down, and a helicopter pilot makes a serious error.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An out-of-control car crashes into a bakery, a base jumper is hit hard, a flood strikes a historic town and a rocket explodes just after take-off. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: A change from cutting hardwood to pine necessitates a switch of location for Bobby Goodson's team, to a site where the logger has previously encountered problems.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team help Roger Webb when his restoration plans for his 1964 Plymouth Fury are halted by his commitments to his family and community.

programme.title: James May: The Reassembler
programme.desc: James tries to put back together a 1959 Suffolk Colt petrol lawnmower, which helped make mowing accessible to the masses by producing a smaller and affordable machine.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: Jonny Smith and Jimmy de Ville head to Korea to find out how it made world-beating cars in just a few years. Jimmy revisits the original Bentley Blower and Jason Plato hits the track in an Alpine A110

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China tries to renovate a Triumph Spitfire sports car so Mike Brewer can sell it for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues to renovate the Triumph Spitfire, replacing the differential and rear shock absorbers and having the bumpers and handles chromed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 1966 Morris Minor Traveller for the bargain price of 2,400, and makes plans for Edd China to renovate it so he sell it on for at least 7,000

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer invests in a rare 1967 amphibious car, but it has some underlying problems that could eat away at his potential profit margin.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tracks down a Lincoln Continental, which set new style standards for luxury sedans in the 1960s. However, tastes have changed, and Edd hatches a refurb plan.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to track down an MGA - the car that came before the high-selling MGB - for the workshop.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to track down the first-ever Bond car, a 1963 Sunbeam Alpine. He finds a rust-free, race-ready motor, but Edd China discovers some surprises in the engine bay.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Mike and Valerie crash a high-stakes poker game to discover the location of a jet, while Ken and Danny hunt down the luxury yacht belonging to a so-called 'womaniser'.

programme.title: Aircrash Confidential
programme.desc: Planes are an ideal terrorist target, carrying hundreds of potential victims and assuring worldwide publicity. How can new technologies stop hijackers getting on board?.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Russell's 30-year-old truck feels the strain on a run from Alice Springs to central Queensland. Meanwhile, Sludge wrestles flooded roads to deliver fuel to farmers.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton visits Germany, where he discovers a nuclear core from a secret Nazi weapon-testing factory.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a bargain Range Rover P38 and mechanic Edd China sets about mending it. They then take the car to Exmoor for a final test drive before looking for a buyer.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard locks horns with a fellow dealer over a buffalo's skull in Oxfordshire. Plus, a private girls' school in Hertfordshire seeks top marks for its haul of furniture.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard heads to Petworth in West Sussex - the antiques capital of the south of England. He also bids on an unusual fire screen in Lancashire.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Huddersfield Town v Leeds United and Queens Park Rangers v Preston North End.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton visits Germany, where he discovers a nuclear core from a secret Nazi weapon-testing factory.

programme.title: Taken at Birth
programme.desc: In the mid-1940s, Dr Thomas Jugarthy Hicks opened the Hicks Community Clinic in McCaysville, Georgia. Within a decade, he was not only performing illegal abortions but selling newborns on the black market. Jane Blasio now works to reunite those 'stolen' babies with their biological families. Plus, she uncovers some shocking truths about Dr Hicks himself, who sold hundreds of babies in the 1950s and 1960s. Now, some Hicks babies are reunited with their families, and some are learning about relatives they never got to meet.

programme.title: Taken at Birth
programme.desc: After a tireless search for Diane's birth father, Lisa and Jane are finally able to track down a possible match. Plus, Chris makes another discovery about Dr Thomas Hicks.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Surya Toha, who vanished in March 2010 after dropping her two boys at school in Coral Springs, Florida. Chilling CCTV footage revealed exactly what happened to her.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of retailer Harvey Fuson in January 2011. The 66-year-old was well-loved by members of his local community and the manner of his death shocked the Tennessee town of Cumberland Gap as well as the entire Tri-State area.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: FBI agents discover the bodies of three drug dealers floating in a river and begin to suspect they may have been murdered by a group of corrupt police officers.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team makes a dramatic rescue when a spaniel gets trapped underground. Plus, a challenging situation arises when a dog and her pups are attacked by bees.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A West Highland Terrier called Chester dislikes skateboarders. Concerned that he will bite someone, his owners take him to see Chris to see if he can help tame him.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride's mother has firm ideas about the wedding dress, while another does not approve of her daughter's desire for a sexy look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Natalie is hoping Kleinfeld's will be the last stop on her bridal gown tour, while Amy has lost five stone but still sees herself as overweight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Tameria wants to wear a simple dress, but members of her fashion-forward family has other ideas. Hailey puts aside her sexy dress vision to please her future mother-in law.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and his team battle to save a puppy with broken ribs and internal bleeding, while Dr Baier attempts surgery he has never done before to treat a family's beloved rat.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Rescue dog Benji's heart problem concerns Dr Chris, and Smudge the cat's injuries shock Lisa, who hopes surgeons can reconstruct the animal's leg. Tim helps out some alligators.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Amber, who is 23 and weighs more than 600lb, relies on her family for even the simplest of tasks, so she travels more than 2,000 miles for weight-loss surgery.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Susan is committed to drastic weight loss, but when a medical disorder affects her mobility, her plight becomes a matter of life and death.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Siblings Robin and Chris are both obese and have already lost a sibling to obesity. Now, Chris's son Garrett, already 600lbs at the age of 20, wants to lose weight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Siblings Robin and Chris are both obese and have already lost a sibling to obesity. Now, Chris's son Garrett, already 600lbs at the age of 20, wants to lose weight.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kristi is marrying a pro-baseball pitcher and needs a glamorous dress, while sports fan Jenna wants a gown that will impress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Patti Ann makes the trip all the way from Chicago to find the right dress for her Bahamas wedding, while Merav has budget issues when she starts looking for her gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant girl Ashley wants a completely new look, although her family is not keen on the idea, while rodeo queen Becky wants to stand out.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Injured army vet Shealynn is treated to a surprise when comedian Seth Meyers turns up, while model Ashley wants a slinky dress that also gets the approval of her father.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Pageant queen Anastagia wants to choose her own dress, but first she needs to battle her mother's influence. Lisa clashes with her mum over an ivory gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Britanny shops with her uncle, who insists her dress has lots of sparkle, while Nicole finds her father is eager to please.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Triplet Samantha finds her opinionated sisters want to make the final dress decision, while siblings Jessica and Kristen shop together.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Rasha needs a ball gown that will wow all 700 guests at her wedding, while Melissa's father has a surprise for her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer knows what she wants from her dress, but her bridesmaids do not like the idea and push her into trying other styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride's mother has firm ideas about the wedding dress, while another does not approve of her daughter's desire for a sexy look.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.sub-title: On the Road: Las Vegas - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Theresa Caputo is still on the road, surprising fans in Las Vegas, and has to work quickly when the woman she has come to surprise with a reading shows up early.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Inspired by old scrapbooks uncovered by her Dad, Theresa goes to a genealogist to learn more about her family history, and receives some shocking news.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.sub-title: Don't Give Up Your Day Job
programme.desc: Theresa enrols in beauty school after a trip to the barbershop with Larry, and connects a woman with her son.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: A woman tries to beat her savings record as she celebrates her 40th year of coupon collecting. Meanwhile, Cole has stockpile requests from his new room-mate at university.

programme.title: Extreme Couponing
programme.desc: Maryann throws her daughter a coupon-themed 12th birthday party. Meanwhile, a 15-year-old girl reveals why she is in charge of her family's grocery shopping.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Relatives of the Genesee River serial killer, Arthur Hutchinson, reveal how his heinous crimes impacted the family. Were there any signs of murderous intentions?.

programme.title: British Police: Our Toughest Cases
programme.sub-title: Andrew Cameron, James Cameron & Alexander Dewar: The Revenge Attack
programme.desc: In 2009, the sleepy Norfolk village of Fakenham was hit with the horrific and brutal murder of 45-year-old Steven Murphy. Andrew Cameron and his friend Alexander Dewar denied the act, but were convicted by a jury at Norwich Crown Court.

programme.title: Taken at Birth
programme.desc: Jane and Lisa meet the first Hicks baby, Stephen Dilbeck. Plus, Chris and Hicks' granddaughter Sallie open a vault in search of birth records that may be inside.
